intro: Illigera ternata, commonly known as the slender illigera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
